etymologies: early 17th century; earliest use found in Philemon Holland (1552–1637), translator. From geometry + -ize

definitions: To consider or treat geometrically; to reduce to or render in geometrical terms.
To work geometrically; to adopt a geometrical approach.

notes.text: Used chiefly with allusion to the phrase ἀεὶ γεωμετρεῖν τὸν θεόν ‘God is always practising geometry’, attributed to Plato (Plutarch Quaestiones Conviviales 718 B).
